reviews.review_msg: The course requires a significant amount of reading, and expects active participation. Unlike other courses where you can get away with not doing the reading for a week, this professor will call on you if you're too quiet. They contribute minimally to the class and make students do most of the lecturing. With this prof Chat GTP is your bestfriend.

Not a very understanding/ supportive teacher. I was really disappointed with their assignments as it relied heavily on ChatGPT and not on the profs own skills at teaching. I would not take any of their courses again, which is disappointing as I really enjoy history and thought I would love this course.

I appreciated her as a professor, but she sometimes can be overly harsh when assigning activities based on the course readings syllabus. It can be a bit annoying and a lot of pressure. However, if you are well-prepared or interested, taking the HIST 204 course benefits from a quiz survey and some essential assignments ."

Unclear course criteria, very disorganized, un-invested in their students' learning outcomes. 
If you are studying history you may do well in their courses. They care much more about formatting, technicalities, and due dates than they do about learning course content.

I agree with some of these comments for the most part - El is a pretty disorganized prof (probably the most disorganized prof I will ever meet), and yes, it got frustrating at times. But honestly, she's not as bad as most of these comments say. She's caring, willing to listen, and teaches some interesting (and different!) content.

I think Professor Chenier means well, but I struggled with how the course was (not) organized. The way items were marked with little feedback meant I had to meet with her several times and it left me wondering why she didn't raise her concerns with feedback as had I not done so, I could have made the same mistakes again. Would not take again.
Avoid her at all costs. She is a waste of time professor. You will learn nothing from her.

Fact is, if you show that you care about the material, do the readings and contribute in class, you're going to do very well. But if you're not willing to to put in the effort/have an open mind to racial and LGBTQ2IA+ issues, don't even bother. Elise can be unorganized and is unorthodox in teaching, but she cares and works with you no matter what.

You either love her or you don't. I don't. She is extremely unorganized (proof showed through her messy office as well), constantly puts last minute assignments on us, expects us to be available for weekend events (as if we don't already have insane amounts of readings each week or other classes), and is unclear about what she really expects.

Eh... Could have been much better if it was not so requiring for a 100-level course. Can't imagine what her other classes are like. TAKE THIS CLASS ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU'RE DOING! Really heavy, really professional.

Y'all are just bitter. Difficult course, but worth it! Mainly conceptual content, but changed my outlook on life and really improved me as a writer. Elise is a professional. Funny and self-aware, gives great lectures and encourages discussion. Don't take if you're not willing for your GPA to take a knock, but imo not really what's important in uni.
Expectations unclear and same goes for her assignments. Was not open to any other ideas in class other than her own and made writing for difficult.

If you're considering taking this course for breadth, I would steer clear. Barely learned any actual historical facts- just vague concepts and theories. Emphasis on "thinking like a historian" but I'm not a history major so that's no use to me... Prof is super condescending and essay topic was vague.

Really great lectures that she relates to current events to help you understand and apply the learning. Stays on top of current events and stays relevant. Course material is really interesting and she's just great

Great prof who knows her stuff. She's passionate and the discussions in her classes are fantastic. Main problem I've had is that she uses Canvas a lot. This is a problem because she isn't very tech savvy. She didn't find my final essay until I reminded her and before that she said that I didn't hand it in and didn't bother to check.

I loved the content of the class but hated the prof. Her criteria for Primary Source Analysis was vague and always changing. She was not at all receptive to feedback, even when she asked for it, and she tried too hard to seem cool. Also, in the comments of my final she went on a rant about how hard it is to date a trans man or something?

Actually super surprised she doesn't have a great rating as she's a super interesting lecturer, pretty fair and understanding about assignments which is a nice change.  Learnt so much from this class and as a history major think it was very valuable to take as it adds so much to how i think about history.  More disorganized than usual profs tho.

Great prof but that is only if you put in effort.  You learn a lot about the topics and you learn a lot about life. Definitely not for people who only want to pass a class.   She has lots to offer.  Do not miss it if you want to aim higher and see the values in education.

Patronizing and condescending, if you don't agree with her you're wrong. Too much busy work for a 100 level course, does not respond to her emails to meet with students. Unhelpful! Apparently, I'm beginning to think like a historian 3 years into my degree, um ok.

Dr. Chenier was a great prof. Opened my mind to new ideas through in-class discussions and readings. However, be prepared to do A LOT of reading to do well in the class. Also, marking scheme was a little ambiguous. If you agree with her line of thinking great, you'll do well. If not, you might have a problem and she does not give great feedback.
Amazing prof. Expect lots of effort to get a decent mark, but it's totally worth it! This course may even help you become a better person at the end of it. Don't take it if you're a slacker.

In the many years that I have been in post-secondary studies it is rare that I have found a prof that can really challenge me and make me work hard to earn my grade, while also learning and admiring them as a person. Elise is wonderful and I highly recommend that everyone takes a class with her and gets to experience what I did. Love you Elise!
Lacking of course related historical knowledge, for example not knowing not all concentration camps were extermination camps. Essay topic was broad and unclear for a 800 word essay.

Professor Chenier is literally perfect! She creates an open & comfortable learning environment. Tutorials are discussion based. Course content is so informative, & Professor Chenier is clearly passionate about what she teaches. A LOT of work, but if you feel passionate about the subject you will do well. This has been one of my favourites classes!

Dr. Chenier is an amazing prof. She expects a lot but in a good way. She makes you realize your full potential and the skills she provides you with are invaluable. She is enthusiastic and always willing to help and talk to you.

Dr. Chenier is a great prof. She does expect a lot but she is also willing to help a lot. Her lectures are interesting and clear. Highly recommend her. Especially if you're a history major as she teaches you many skills needed in the field of study.
Elise is a great and fun teacher. Yes, it does require effort, but it was well worth it. Her class and material were life changing and fascinating.
Prof C is so very accommodating.She knew that part of the subject matter was tough for me and she would send me the lecture notes ahead of time so I was prepared. I am so grateful for that!

Stop complaining professor Chenier is a really amazing professor. She does expect a lot but you have to put in the effort. None of her classes are easy grades. You have to work for them. Once you get to know her she is amazing. Best decision I made was to take her class.

Chenier is an excellent professor if you put in the time and are willing to learn new ways of developing yourself as a student. She is a clear narrator and was very concise in her ideas presented. She demands a lot from her students, this is not a course which you can easily glide through! I'm excited to take more courses with her.

You want to do well you have to put in the effort. Sure she give a lot of work but it is manageable work. She wants student to view and understand history differently, her classes revolve around that idea. I would love to take another class with her

Prof. C. is a great instructor and I think that many of the comments here are from disgruntled students who were unwilling to work for their mark! She does give quite a bit of work (weekly assignments) but they are never too vigorous. Do not take her if looking for an easy grade! Be prepared to earn it!

Although this course is quite demanding Chenier makes it worth it! She is interesting, funny, and creates an open environment where even first years feel comfortable contributing. I would love to take more classes with her.

Elise is a lovely person, but she expects FAR too much from the people in her class.  For a 100 level course, I found the workload extremely large.  She thinks that students do not have anything else to do outside her class.  Sends out assignments on a Friday due Monday that are only for participation marks.

She was an amazing professor. She tries and makes her lectures fun and enjoyable for everyone. She loves to help students, cause she does not want to see someone fail. I will and would take another class with her.

I never liked Canadian history to begin with, but needed this course to fulfill a requirement. The special topic was Trudeaumania. Chenier's course just reaffirmed my opinion of Cdn. hist. What turned me off was her being self-absorbed, bigoted, and irritable. Only good thing she did was to hire TAs. I would probably fail if she was in tutorials.
Professor Chenier expects far too much for the minimal guidance she provides, and belittles the efforts that do not meet her 'high' standards. Never again.

I had a great time in her class.  She was very interesting and passionate but she assigns a lot of work for one class.  While lecturing she likes to open up for discussion or ask the class questions, but gets a bit annoyed when someone doesn't answer the way she wanted them to

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Her marking scheme is completely inconsistent and ambiguous, and is entirely unapproachable. She is obviously passionate about history, but the way she presented it caused a lot of confusion and frustration throughout the class.

chenier is the craziest prof! shes wacky and funny. however, she is one tough marker! make sure you cover your ass good before you hand in your assigns. shes always questioning. but the course is very fun and interesting. make sure to know some aboriginal history first.

Elise is unaware that anything else may be occurring in a students life other than her course.  Her assignments are unclear and after failing 80% of the class on one assignment did not take responsibility that it might be her teaching methods.  Pretends to be approachable - don't fall for it.

She actually refuses to help students saying we should be able to figure it out. She won't say what she is looking for when marking and her marking is very inconsistant. I think that she has no clue what she wants and that's why her grades have no reasoning behind them and why she won't tell you how things can improve.
No Comments
Judging by these previous posts, some people really need to grow up: Elise is a fantastic prof, extremely intelligent and interesting, and she cares about her students.

Don't know why she gets bad ratings. She is a fair marker, posts her notes on webct and knows her info. A reading and writing extensive class thou. Mandatory particip, 2 essays & exam (8 pg and 11 pg) Either she was a horrible teacher in the past and has changed, or students want a prof that hands out A's to everyone.  This is all coming from a C+/
No Comments

I thought the marking was fair, and her lectures not bad.  However, she's as biased as a professor you can find, and, if you are planning on taking any of her clasess, be prepared for an endless tirade against men, americans, the federal government,... it just goes on and on and on and on...
No Comments
hardy but a goody
oh boy she is a tough marker but i guess the lecure was alrite--she keeps talking and pbl sucks. anyways this class not a gpa booster --dont take the class she's a tough marker

This was a difficult class, but very interesting and worth the hard work. Chenier has high standards but is not unfair. I found her very helpful and friendly. Great sense of dry humor. The amount of work was more than other upper level seminar classes, but the course outline did say it was a class meant to prepare one for grad school.

Very interesting lectures, but that's about it. PBL was terrible and a joke, very unclear instructions, unhelpful, insulting, pushes her opinions on the class, was basically a course on sexuality and gender, not the history of the family in Canada.  Our final exam was on Bill C-38 and whether we thought it should be passed? I mean really....
she's horrible, rude and unhelpful

If you like history avoid this person. Spends five minutes discussing history and then the rest of the time turning the seminar into the "Ellen show" I don't care about your alternative life style, just teach what you have on the syllabus and save the preaching.

She is so tough with marking. It is tough to get a good mark with her. Not only that but she is a total feminisht. I dont know if this class is much about family. Plus she makes you do so many readings which dont help you much in any way. Remember you have other classes and your time will be consume

worse prof ever. unhelpful, unapproachable, pushes her ideas onto the class. very proud of living alternt lifestyle and pushes her anti-hetersexual views onto class discussions. moods swings mak for hostile classroom. work overload no help, no choices on papers limited scope in teaching

Lectures were interesting but the assignments were unclear and marked unfairly.  She gives enough reading and writing to make this a 400 lvl course but she gives students NO choice. Topics are all written by her and reflect her interests -leads to a serious shortage of research material. AVOID!

This class was supposed to be about family but according to the prof,family is composed of gay/lesbian people and women.what about dad, grandma, grandpa, uncles, aunts and oh yeah kids?? DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH THIS PROF! unfair marking,sarcastic,unrealistic # of readings.from a 3.5gpa student

Wow, she was the worst Prof I have ever had, Way too much reading, assignments are not clear and she marks extremly hard and unfairly. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. Total feminist bull'ish and I am a Feminist! She goes way to far!

STOP!!! i know u're thinkin of taking her classes during summer semester but seriously, do u really want to listen to her go on and go about gender and sexuality?! this woman bases everything on sexuality. the worst prof ever, not approachable hard marker horride personality
No Comments
interesting and funny, The first Can. hist. class I've actually enjoyed. highly recommended
Absolutely worst course I have ever taken anywhere and I have had some doozies! Her fascist take on women's history made me embarassed to be both a feminist and a lesbian. Avoid at all costs.
Very Biased and unhelpful, if you like history DO NOT take a class with her!

This instructor is the reason I have dropped my history major. Absolutely worst instructor in my three years at SFU. Biased and obnoxious. Students who disputed her peurile feminist version of history
 were literally shouted into silence.

Took this class as the last lower level history and it was nearly my last. Totally disorganised and lectures often never went anywhere. Her feminist bias and bizarre arguments ruined history for many  of us. If you like history avoid her like the plague.

More challenging than hard. A hard marker but marks better when the quality of work was up to snuff. She's pretty funny, too. Demanding but offers different perspectives that make you think. Seminars important so reading is essential. Demanding but overall a good course.

lectures:unorganized,no clarity,no sequencing of events.Papers:hard maker,big on grammar,very biased view(her way or the highway).Not friendly,not helpful.Social history means ALL of Canada,not one class or gender.2nd year course but marks and teaches like 4th yr.DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSE WITH HER.

Very unorganized lectures, which makes it so hard to study for the final.  The lectures were cramed with information but she didn't really put much emphasis on anything in particular, meaning I have no clue what to study from.  And, she also likes to sing which she really SHOULD NOT do!

Very hard marker, very specific expectations. Unorganised lectures. Tutorials were scary...do your reading. Huge emphasis on women's and Chinese-Canadian history. Did not feel it live up to it's title. Not specific to what she wants on assignments or the final, and very LONG and tough final exam.

Lectures were packed full of information. Yes they were organized, but so much information. No Mid term on top of this means major studying for final. Hard to fine clear outline of what she really wants for papers and exam.
forget any canadian studies classes that you enjoyed... her's will ruin them for you. get out while you still can!

Very unorganized lecture style, often ran out of time at the end and rushed.  Hard to take notes for, ambiguous assignments.  Close-minded view on history, with bias towards womens issues and oral history.  If you don't agree with her, watch out - your mark will reflect it!  NOT recommended!!!
No Comments
